title: Before 1 January 2022, will a release date for The Winds of Winter be announced by the author and/or publisher?
preds: Holding out at 1% just in case he makes an announcement tomorrow on his blog to get fans excited about what’s in store for 2022.
Down to 0% after a year of waiting and neglecting this question for a while
The x-mas reading season marketing period is closed-up!
News story about an internal source claims a release in 2023
According to Martin in his blog he hopes to have it out sometime next year but I still doubt it will be announced before Jan 1 2022.

Not looking good is it.  Last blog post about content was the resurrection of non-ASOIAF material (Aug 10th), but he seems to be posting intermittently about other things, which suggests to me he's working this month (1). 1. https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/

-14%. Time decay and still a long way to go. Only real clue I can see about progress is his last post on 'Not a Blog'. Where he mentions that he has been making good progress and he was once able to write 150 pages a month back in 1999. Also, 'he has a long way to go'. Assuming that he can write at half or 2/3rds that speed (300-450 pages by year end) and that he is roughly 2/3rds of the way through writing the rough draft AND they are continuously editing as they go...its possible they could announce by year end? I figure this will be a 1000-1200 page book.  https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/tag/the-winds-of-winter/

First deadline was end of 2016... failed
Since then we've heard 'end of 2017', 2019, before WorldCon in 2020, etc.
Still nothing concrete, hence going with only a 5% chance of this year

Martin is famous for his severe case of Completion Deficit Disorder.  He is strongly inclined to tinker--those of us with Completion Deficit Disorder have a hard time realizing that most of the time good enough is good enough--and it's not like he needs the money.  So probably no announcement by this deadline.
There's a lot that he's been up to since April 15th (1), which is the oldest post on page 1 of his blog. None of these activities appear to be writing TWOW. 1. https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/

I don't believe GRRM will announce a confirmed release date for The Winds of Winter before 01/22. Martin has always struggled to finish his books quickly, because of his immense attention to detail and desire to perfectly world-build. He has stated recently that he is very behind on his progress of TWOW, and if he couldn't complete the book during the pandemic, I doubt he will even be close to finishing it by 01/22. He has also stated that a lot of his focus has been on other projects he is working on, including HBO's Game of Thrones prequel series, House of the Dragon.
Dropping on time left in the year
Too busy playing Monopoly with imaginary friends, using real money he made off the first books.

Fans of the books will know it's now been ten years for writing this month (1). But while looking for a quick reference stumbled across the quote from his blog regarding finishing the book (2); "I wrote hundreds and hundreds of pages of THE WINDS OF WINTER in 2020.   The best year I’ve had on WOW since I began it.    Why?  I don’t know.   Maybe the isolation.   Or maybe I just got on a roll.   Sometimes I do get on a roll. I need to keep rolling, though.   I still have hundreds of more pages to write to bring the novel to a satisfactory conclusion. That’s what 2021 is for, I hope. I will make no predictions on when I will finish.   Every time I do, assholes on the internet take that as a “promise,” and then wait eagerly to crucify me when I miss the deadline.   All I will say is that I am hopeful. I have a zillion other things to do as well, though.   My plate is full to overflowing.   Every time I wrap up one thing, three more things land on me.   Monkeys on my back, aye, aye, I’ve sung that song before.   So many monkeys.   And Kong." That doesn't bode well if he wrote 100s of pages in 2020, and has 100s more to go to just finish the book. Announcement for early 2022 maybe?  1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Winds_of_Winter#Writing_history
2. https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/2021/02/02/reflections-on-a-bad-year/

If we're talking about his "blog" https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/ Here's the full post from April 13th and you can decide for yourself if this is a man thinking about The Winds of Winter; "Way back when on LiveJournal, when I started this column or journal or whatever it is, I called it my “Not A Blog,” because I could see that regular blogging was a lot of work, and I didn’t think I had the time to devote to it.   I was late on a book even then, though I do not recall which one.  I figured I would just make posts from time to time, when I had an important announcement, when the mood struck me, whatever. Somehow, though, over the decades, the Not A Blog became a blog, and what I had intended as a occasional pleasure and a way to stay in touch with my readers has become a Blog (ironically, at the same time as everyone else was abandoning their blogs for Facebook and Twitter), complete with a sense of obligation.   And when a lot of stuff happens very fast, I fall further and further behind. I am hugely behind right now, and the prospect of trying to catch up is feeling increasingly oppressive. My life has become one of extremes these past few months.   Some days I do not know whether to laugh or cry, to shoot off fireworks and dance in the streets or crawl back into bed and pull the covers over my head.   The good stuff that has been happening to me has been very very very good, the kind of thing that will make a year, or a career.  But the bad stuff that is happening has been very very very bad, and it is hard to cherish the good and feel the joy when the shadows are all around. If any of you read the stories about me on the internet, you will know my good news.   I have a new five-year deal with HBO, to create new GOT successor shows (and some non-related series, like ROADMARKS) for both HBO and HBO Max.  It’s an incredible deal, an amazing deal, very exciting, and I want to tell you all about it… although it seems the press has already done it.   There are stories in all the trades.   You can read about it there.    (These days I almost never get to break any news about myself, the Hollywood press is always ahead of me.   Some of their stories are even accurate).   I will blog about it, I expect, but not today. On the other side of the coin… well, I am now fully vaccinated, hurrah hurray, that’s good.   However, I have now lost six friends since November.  (Only a couple to Covid.   Alas, I am old, and so are many of my friends.   Valar morghulis, I guess).   And a seventh friend, a very old and dear friend who has been a huge part of my life for a long time, is in the hospital, very sick, recovering from surgery… at least we hope he is recovering. Honestly, it is hard to dance in the streets even for the deal of a lifetime when another loved one dies every two/ three weeks, and that has been going on for me since November, when my longtime editor Kay McCauley passed away. There’s lots more going on as well.   Meow Wolf stuff.   Railroad stuff.   Beastly Books has reopened, but the JCC is still shuttered.   The Jets traded Sam Darnold away.   I am going to be leaving my cabin in a couple of months.    I am close to delivering  PAIRING UP, a brand new Wild Cards book. I will tell you about some of this, I guess.   But not today."

https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/
He says he's leaving his cabin in a few months. I was under the impression that he wasn't planning to do that until he finished the winds of winter.  Although his latest Wildcards book is coming out in July so maybe he is leaving for that reason.

EDIT:
The reason is simple: there's money to be made, and networks as well as production companies need ever more "new" "content in order to keep consumers of their content boarded. Sequels and prequels of existing serials are THE secret to success. Soon back by popular demand.

One of his 5 pitches to HBO he made in 2020 has been accepted, so I don't see him heading back to the desk to continue writing The Winds of Winter in the immediate future. The novel it's based on, "Roadmarks", was written by Roger Zelazny. One article described Martin's respect for RZ as; "Martin has a special affinity for Zelazny's work, as he adapted Zelazny's The Last Defende of Camelot for The Twilight Zone in 1985. "It was the first script of mine ever to be filmed," he said. "Roger was a friend, a mentor, and one of the greatest science fiction writers who ever lived."" (1) 1. https://www.gamespot.com/articles/george-r-r-martin-pitched-5-shows-to-hbo-in-2020-and-they-said-yes-to-roadmarks/1100-6488091/

GRRM blogged about his progress in 2020. He wrote a lot, but still has a lot left. Won't make any firm predictions on when he'll finish. This doesn't move my prediction much, I still think its basically a toss up and that our first indication will be his blog when he actually finishes the writing. Blog post here which isn't too long:
https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/2021/02/02/reflections-on-a-bad-year/ or news article about the blog post for more context on the other projects he is also working on.
https://ew.com/books/george-rr-martin-winds-of-winter-update/

Revising up very slightly on https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/2021/02/02/reflections-on-a-bad-year/?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter He has made similar comments multiple times before. However presumably each time it must become slightly more likely as he has written more words.
Very difficult to predict as the author is sporadic with his release of books. The other editions were not swift in being released, he has been writing this one for a while.

Hey cool, a new show set in the ASOIAF universe, that's absolutely not interfering with the delivery of a book I've been waiting for. For almost a literal decade now.  https://www.polygon.com/game-of-thrones/2021/1/21/22242930/hbo-game-of-thrones-series-dunk-and-egg-george-r-r-martin

Yes, at 60% probability for the time being. 
His previous books took years, although this one is taking much longer. COVID seemed to both give and take time from him (reflected in his blogs). He was also distracted by US political events. With politics 'over' and COVID wrapping up, he might have more creative space to write and uphold his teaser that WoW would be released in 2021. https://epicstream.com/news/MadalenaDaleziou/Why-George-RR-Martin-Is-Taking-So-Long-to-Write-The-Winds-of-Winter
https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/tag/writing/

Question is about an announcement and not the book being released.
GRR Martin seems to have almost finished the book and say it will be announced as soon as he's done.
On the business side, the sooner the better if they want to capitalize on the tv show's success. However, we could have given the same arguments for the past 3 years.
The odds are a bit higher than a coin flip.
Very little information available - last hopeful guess was summer 2020 but there has been a history of over optimistic forecasts. Better than even chance.

GRRM has suggested originally it could come out as early as 2014, after a June 2011 publication of A Dance with Dragons, and has managed to shoot past multiple deadlines including my personal favorite from his blog on 21st May 2019; "if I don’t have The Winds of Winter in hand when I arrive in New Zealand for Worldcon, you have here my formal written permission to imprison me in a small cabin on White Island, overlooking that lake of sulfuric acid, until I’m done." (1). Worldcon was originally scheduled for July 29th 2020, much to some fans disappointment, there's was no imprisonment, but technically he never arrived at Worldcon.  Given his workload, summarized pretty concisely by @Maximumtrees, and his history of grossly underestimating the impact his other projects has on his writing, I don't believe Winds will be release in 2021 and I can only hope the show writers have nothing to do with putting together A Dream of Spring after his death sometime in the 2030s.  1. https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/2019/05/21/thanks-new-zealand/
Hard to handicap, but there have been several false dawns here: on the more positive side though, presumably he has been doing some work on it.

He's been working on it for a decade, and hasn't seemed to get any closer to release. Maybe if he stopped writing screenplays for tv shows, beyond just Game of Thrones, or stopped writing other books/stories, he might finish in his lifetime...

I think that the publisher will announce a release date as soon as they have the manuscript. Obvi they are going to publish it and they know enough about the mechanics of publishing and the particulars of this series to give a release date as soon as they have a manuscript to work with. He has in the past announced release dates for his books in his blog, but only for books he has finished. He teases completion dates for TWOW occasionally (ever few years it seems) but hasn't (that I can find) ever announced a release date for any book that he hasn't actually finished writing.  So the question is really, will GRRM finish TWOW before January 1 2022?
Base rate for this one is tricky because we're already well past  expectations  quick re-cap
AGOT Aug 96
AKOK Feb 99 (30 months)
ASOS Nov 00 (21 months)
AFOC Nov 05 (60 months)
ADWD July 11 (68 months)
TWOW  (113 months and counting) I've got no idea on this one, he has blogged about getting closer to finishing but I don't follow his blog closely enough to make intelligent comparisons to his previous predictions. Some people who have think his wording signals that he really is close because he has switched tenses about the book, etc.  
I think for a better base rate that we can measure and observe indicators for, I'd need to know how often he teased completion dates for his previous books in this series (I think his process is significantly different between this and his other projects) and how far off those dates were.  I'm sure someone somewhere has parsed this but I haven't found it. https://georgerrmartin.com/notablog/  for now I'm going to err on the side of optimism and assume that something good is going to come of the covid quarantine in the form of him having time to finish his book.

George is supposedly writing more during the pandemic. He has been close-ish to finishing for years. I suspect the release date will be announced sometime in mid-2021. (No way to do base rate calculations with his book releases. I have tried for years. The math says he should have released two more books by now. He will get to it when he gets to it, and the pandemic seems to have helped him get to writing).
Even the most devoted fan blogs don't think George R.R. Martin will have this completed by December 2021, leaving editors not time to get this ready for publication by Jan. 1. 2022. Dracarys.
The release date was projected by George RR Martin to be "sometime in 2021"

The author claims to be largely done with the book.  It takes an average of 3.5 months or less to publish once it's completed.  The publisher will rush to announce a release date once the manuscript is completed due to the overwhelming interest among fans.
Thumb suck. There is money to be made so skewed toward more likely.

There is no real reason to believe that this is anything more than a pure toss up. Beyond the normal problems revolving around creative projects and publishing, the game of throne series has addition complications with upcoming HBO spinoff series. The book while not directly tied to the live action series likely will want to establish official cannon or even change directions from previously screened content. All these factors may have a role in delaying it past 2022 or none at all. Likewise, at 71 and rather rotund there is no reason to believe that health factors may not play a role. Pure toss up.

https://www.inverse.com/entertainment/winds-of-winter-release-date-prophecy-azor-ahai INVERSE
MAE ABDULBAKI "GEORGE R.R. MARTIN HAS BEEN WRITING THE WINDS OF WINTER FOR NEARLY A DECADE NOW. However, Martin says his writing efforts over the last several months have been especially fruitful (probably because he’s in a secluded cabin) and there is finally hope that the sixth book in his A Song of Ice and Fire will be finished soon. The Winds of Winter is tentatively due to be completed at some point next year, though it may be for the best to keep expectations low —the book has been delayed a few times before."
THe author is traditionally late meeting all deadlines and the pressure to meet deadlines is currently lessened with other writers finishing the GOT series.

According to the author, "Look, I’ve said before, and I will say again, I don’t play games with news about the books.  I know how many people are waiting, how long they have been waiting, how anxious they are.   I am still working on WINDS.  When it’s done, I will announce it here.  There won’t be any clues to decipher, any codes or hidden meanings, the announcement will be straightforward and to the point.  I won’t time it to coincide with Xmas or Valentine’s Day or Lincoln’s Birthday, the book will not rise from the dead with Jesus on Easter Sunday.  When it is done, I will say that’s it is done, on whatever day I happen to finish."
It appears as though he is not in a rush to commit to a timeframe. 
Low odds.

The Elon Musk of Literature will announce that something will happen.  It probably will, but not when he says.  However, the Q isn't about whether anything actually happens, just about whether it's announced.  Using this criterion, both Al Gore and The Current Incumbent would have won their elections.

He apparently is using this pandemic as a chance to be alone and focus on writing - but he has been so delayed so many times, I find it hard to believe he can finish his book anytime soon.  There are so many weaving plot lines - and I suspect his book will likely morph into 2 books before it is done (plus however many after that he needs to write).
